_comment: Shared environment rules that can apply across all client infrastructures.

internal.description: Trusted internal network segments within corporate control.

vpn.description: Remote-access VPN networks logically treated as internal but higher risk.

wifi.description: Wireless access networks; can be internal (corporate) or guest (untrusted).

guest.description: Untrusted guest / partner networks with internet-only or restricted access.

standard_user.description: Regular employee accounts with limited privileges.

important_user.description: Executives or key business users whose compromise has higher impact.

administrator.description: Privileged accounts used for system administration or security functions.

service_account.description: Non-interactive accounts used by services, applications, and scheduled tasks.

contractor.description: External users with time-bound or limited access.

general_rules.description: VPN pools are internal but carry extra risk due to remote access.
Guest WiFi networks are untrusted and should be strongly segmented.
Administrator accounts must always be treated as high risk and require MFA.
Service accounts should not be used interactively; interactive use raises concern.
